@graph.name: Oatmeal Peanut Butter Banana Cookies - JoyFoodSunshine
@graph.description: Peanut butter banana cookies are naturally sweetened & gluten-free. Easy to make with 8 ingredients in 15 minutes - a healthy snack/treat!

@graph.name: How long do peanut butter banana oatmeal cookies last?

acceptedAnswer.text: This recipe lasts for up to 1 week in the refrigerator, and 2 months in the freezer.
Yes, you can use an egg replacer, chia egg or flax egg (1 TBS chia/flax mixed with 2.5 TBS warm water).

@graph.name: Can I use natural peanut butter?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, but you might need to add 1-2 TBS more oats.

@graph.name: Oatmeal Peanut Butter Banana Cookies
@graph.description: These peanut butter banana cookies are naturally sweetened and gluten-free. They are easy to make with only 8 ingredients in 15 minutes, and healthy enough for breakfast!

video.name: Peanut Butter Banana Cookies
video.description: These peanut butter banana cookies are naturally sweetened and gluten-free. They are easy to make with only 8 ingredients in 15 minutes, and healthy enough for breakfast!

recipeIngredient: 2 TBS honey or pure maple syrup
½ to 1 cup chocolate chips (or other add ins like shredded coconut, dried cranberries, raisins, etc.)

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Line two baking sheets with parchment paper, set aside
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Line two baking sheets with parchment paper, set aside

recipeInstructions.text: In a large mixing bowl, mash the bananas.
recipeInstructions.name: In a large mixing bowl, mash the bananas.

recipeInstructions.text: Add peanut butter, honey, egg and vanilla and stir to combine.
recipeInstructions.name: Add peanut butter, honey, egg and vanilla and stir to combine.

recipeInstructions.text: Add oats, cinnamon and sea salt and stir until combined.
recipeInstructions.name: Add oats, cinnamon and sea salt and stir until combined.

recipeInstructions.text: If desired, add mix-ins and stir until evenly distributed.
recipeInstructions.name: If desired, add mix-ins and stir until evenly distributed.

recipeInstructions.text: Use a 1 tablespoon measuring spoon or a 1 ½ TBS cookie scoop to measure portions of the dough and place them on the prepared baking sheet spaced about 2” apart. Gently flatten the tops of each cookie.
recipeInstructions.name: Use a 1 tablespoon measuring spoon or a 1 ½ TBS cookie scoop to measure portions of the dough and place them on the prepared baking sheet spaced about 2” apart. Gently flatten the tops of each cookie.

recipeInstructions.text: Bake in the preheated oven for 12-15 minutes, or until the tops are just set and the bottoms are very lightly browned.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake in the preheated oven for 12-15 minutes, or until the tops are just set and the bottoms are very lightly browned.

recipeInstructions.text: Let cool on the baking sheet for 5 minutes before transferring to a wire cooling rack to cool completely.
recipeInstructions.name: Let cool on the baking sheet for 5 minutes before transferring to a wire cooling rack to cool completely.

recipeInstructions.text: Serve slightly warm or at room temperature.
recipeInstructions.name: Serve slightly warm or at room temperature.

@graph.keywords: oatmeal peanut butter banana cookies, peanut butter and banana cookies, peanut butter banana cookies, peanut butter banana oatmeal cookies
